conclusion: Initial analysis of the problem setup
Horizontal metal ring fixed with radius r = 0.2 m
Two metal rods each of length r and resistance R0 placed along the diameter, rotating uniformly with angular velocity ω = 600 rad/s
Uniform magnetic field B1 exists in the left half of the ring
Rotating shaft OO' is vertical, passing through the center of the ring
Capacitor connected between tracks with capacitance C = 0.09 F
Switch S connects to terminals 1 and 2
Horizontal metal tracks with distance l1 and capacitor connected between them
Magnetic field region B2 with width l1, length l2, magnetic induction strength B2 = 1 T
Metal rod ab placed perpendicularly to tracks, mass m = 0.01 kg, resistance R = 0.1 Ω
"[" shaped metal frame fcde on insulated tracks, lengths l3 = 0.08 m, masses m = 0.01 kg, resistances R = 0.1 Ω
Given values: l1 = 0.25 m, l2 = 0.068 m, B1 = B2 = 1 T
Center of mass of frame abcd rises by 0.2 m on inclined track before returning into the magnetic field
Need to find charge Q on capacitor after fully charged and determine which plate (M or N) is positively charged
EMF induced in rotating rods calculated using motional EMF formula
Average EMF per rod is ε_avg = 1/2 B1 ω r^2
Total EMF ε_total = B1 ω r^2 = 24 V
Direction of EMF and charge on capacitor plates determined using right-hand rule
Polarity of EMF determines which plate of the capacitor is positively charged
Problem states 'Plate M is positively charged' in the illustration
